events.description: The release of the S&P Global Brazil Services PMI data for January 2026 showing a decline from the previous month.

facts.fact_text: The S&P Global Brazil Services PMI fell to 51.3 in January 2026 from 53.7 in December.

evidences.evidence_text: The S&P Global Brazil Services PMI fell to 51.3 in January 2026 from 53.7 in December

facts.fact_text: Service providers cut jobs for the first time in five months.

evidences.evidence_text: service providers cut jobs for the first time in five months, though the decline was mild.

facts.fact_text: Inflation in the sector eased to a 20-month low.

evidences.evidence_text: Inflation in the sector eased to a 20-month low, broadly aligning with historical norms.

facts.fact_text: Prices charged rose at the slowest pace in seven months.

evidences.evidence_text: Prices charged rose at the slowest pace in seven months but remained elevated.

claims.claim_text: The expansion in the services sector is slower and only marginal.

evidences.evidence_text: pointing to a slower and only marginal expansion.

claims.claim_text: Business confidence is well below its long-run average.

evidences.evidence_text: business confidence dropping to a six-month low and remaining well below its long-run average.

evidence.evidence_text: Reports of limited new work weighed on sentiment, with business confidence dropping to a six-month low
As a result, hiring stalled and service providers cut jobs for the first time in five months
Inflation in the sector eased to a 20-month low, broadly aligning with historical norms.
